H0.text: The top American fiction bestseller in both 1936 and 1937 was the only novel published during the lifetime of its author. Who was she. Margaret Mitchell

H1.text: The top American fiction bestseller in both 1936 and 1937 was the only novel published during the lifetime of its author. Who was she. Harper Lee

H2.text: The top American fiction bestseller in both 1936 and 1937 was the only novel published during the lifetime of its author. Who was she. Edith Wharton

H3.text: The top American fiction bestseller in both 1936 and 1937 was the only novel published during the lifetime of its author. Who was she. Peggy Marsh

A4.text: Gone with the Wind was published in June 1936 and won the National Book Award for Fiction in 1936 and the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction in 1937.

A5.text: Mitchell wrote only one novel that was published during her lifetime, the American Civil War-era novel Gone with the Wind.
